results.title: Tripwire
results.creator_credit: Valerie Morton, David Hirst and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: A character and action driven true-life adventure documentary looking at the Australian Armys secret Norforce unit that forms this Island continents first line of defence across the remote Kimberly region and the Northern Territory. Norforce is also one of the msot dynamic experiments in inter-racial relations as the unit is made up of both white and Aboriginal Australians where the soldiers learn essential survival skills from each other. Narrated by Archie Roach, and featuring the music of the Warumpi Band.

results.title: After Mabo
results.creator_credit: John Hughes, Debra Annear, Richard Frankland and Mirimbiak Nations Aboriginal Corporation
results.brief_description: Filmed over a ten-month period throughout Australia, this probing documentary examines the political controversy surrounding Native Title and the Australian Federal Governments proposed amendments to the Native Title Act, 1993. It follows the Indigenous representatives in their attempt to fight the amendments in the media, in the bush, and in the halls of Parliament House, Canberra. This video is ideally suited to students of history, politics and Aboriginal studies. NOTE: There are no discussion notes included with this title.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Hughes, Debra Annear, Richard Frankland and Mirimbiak Nations Aboriginal Corporation

results.title: Namatjira the painter
results.creator_credit: Stanley Hawes, Ralph Foster and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Traces the life and artistic development of the Aboriginal painter, the late Albert Namatjira. His environment, his introduction to painting, his subsequent success with beautifully original landscapes and his influence on fellow Aborigines are recorded. [Rev. ed. 007430]

results.title: No way to forget
results.brief_description: Based on Richard Frankland’s experiences as a field officer during the Royal Commission into Aboriginal custody, this film follows the journey of Shane as he drives from Swan Hill to Melbourne after a day in the field. During the night, his experiences play on his mind and imagination. He will be haunted by what he has seen.

results.title: Mabo: the life of an Island man (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Trevor Graham, Denise Haslem and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Filmmaker Trevor Graham documented the only film record of the Mabo proceedings in 1989 in his film “Land Bilong islanders” and in the process established a friendship with Eddie Koiki Mabo. This film documents the extraordinary life of a man so passionate about his family and home that he fought an entire nation and its legal system. Sadly, he died five months before the High Court upheld his claim for “Native Title”. However he cemented a place in Australia’s history. This documentary won an AFI award in 1997.

results.title: The Art of tracking
results.creator_credit: Gary Steer, Tina Dalton, Sky Visuals, Telecast, Discovery Communications, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Wild Visuals
results.brief_description: Although the art of tracking is diminishing worldwide, the skill survives and traditionalists are making efforts to revive it. There are pockets of indigenous people who still rely on their skills to hunt animals for their livelihood. Amongst the Aborigines of arid Australia, the Kalahari Bushmen of Africa and the Inuit of the Arctic, the ability to read the earth survives. This program examines the skills of these people from vastly different environments and is the story of the skill not the kill; the story of “nature detectives”. Awarded the Certificate for creative excellence, USA International Film and Video Festival 1997.

results.title: Indigeneous Australians: an Aboriginal community focus
results.creator_credit: Monitor Interactive and New South Wales. Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: An interactive CD-ROM from TAFE which is the first to draw on the comprehensive knowledge and expertise of Aboriginal community members and is an invaluable teaching resource. The concept behind this CD-ROM is to let members of various Aboriginal Communities become teachers of their rich culture. A resource guide accompanies the CD-ROM. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: This CD-ROM is compatible on both Macintosh and IBM compatible PC’s.

results.title: Round up
results.creator_credit: Rima Tamou, Pauline Clague and Core Original Productions
results.brief_description: Two country boys, one white and the other aboriginal find themselves out of place in the hustle and bustle of the big city. What they learn on the journey that they embark upon through unfamiliar territory, is that they are not as different as they first thought.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rima Tamou, Pauline Clague and Core Original Productions

results.title: Harold
results.creator_credit: Steve Thomas, John Moore, Marion Crooke and Flying Carpet Films
results.brief_description: Harold Blair was considered a curiousity at the height of his career as a tenor in the 1940’s. As an Aboriginal, raised on a Reserve, Harold sang songs he had learned from watching Nelson Eddy films, or the classic operatic arias, although later in his career, the music of his own people formed part of his repertoire. Harold Blair’s life is revealed in this documentary through the people who shared his life and influenced his career; chiefly his wife and family. This is an intensly personal and frank look at an Aboriginal pioneer who had to struggle to achieve success and to reconcile his ‘stage persona’ with his Aboriginal identity.

results.title: Australian aborigines: living off the land
results.creator_credit: A.P. Elkin and A I F
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Modern social studies”.
Taken during the University of Sydney’s 1952 expedition to Arnhem Land. This film shows how aborigines live on native animals and plants.
